io_utilities module

src.main.io_utilities.export_as_binary_obj(obj, output_file_path)[source]

Function to serialize a given object and save it in a binary file :param obj: an object, can be a list, scaler, classifier :param output_file_path: path where the json will be saved :return: None

src.main.io_utilities.import_binary_object(input_file_path)[source]

Function used to import a pickle binary file :param input_file_path: the path of the file that need to be imported :return: unserialized python object, or None in case of errors during file reading

src.main.io_utilities.read_raw_data(main_directory_path)[source]

Creates a dataframe with the data stored in the files at the path given The given directory has a structure like: main_directory –subdirectory_category1 —-file —-file —-… –subdirectory_category2 –subdirectory_category3 –… :param main_directory_path: the path given of the main directory :return: a dataframe with 3 columns: the path to the file, content, type :rtype: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

src.main.io_utilities.read_txt_file(file_path)[source]

Return the content from the file from the given path.

Parameters:

file_path – path to the target file

Returns:

file content

Return type:

built-in python string

src.main.io_utilities.save_dict_to_json_file(data, output_file_path)[source]

Function to save a dictionary in a json file at a given path :param data: dictionary that contains pairs of (key, str_value/s), (key, int_value/s) :param output_file_path: path where the json will be saved :return: None
